previewArticle.title: New England Revolution vs. Sporting Kansas City | MLS Match Preview

recapArticle.title: New England Revolution 2, Sporting Kansas City 0 | MLS Match Recap

timelineItems.desc: Reprising their Eastern Conference Semifinal Series matchup from a year ago, the New England Revolution and Sporting Kansas City meet for the first time this season when the clubs face off Saturday evening at Gillette Stadium.
timelineItems.title: KICKOFF: NE Revolution vs Sporting Kansas City

timelineItems.comment: First Half begins.

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: And we're underway in Foxborough! Watch #NEvSKC on @38TheSpot and #SKCTV and follow @SKCgameday. Game on --> http://t.co/NCdKaHizoy

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: With full credit to @aljarov for the prompt, I submit that the surface at Gillette henceforth be known as the "Putt-Putt Pitch."

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 1' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 We're underway! It'll be Jerry Bengtson up top, flanked by @DiegoFagundez14 on the left and @TealBunB on the right.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).
Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Toni (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Diego Fagundez (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Bunbury is definitely floating. Has been seen on the right, left and in the middle #NEREVS

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Long balls and disjointing passes so far from both teams #NEREVS #SportingKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Toni (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is high and wide to the left. Assisted by Seth Sinovic.

timelineItems.name: Ben Saufley
timelineItems.text: At #NERevs game at @GilletteStadium. “Surface: Official Tablet of the NFL!” on the screens. That what this is?

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Jerry Bengtson (New England Revolution) left footed shot from the center of the box misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: MISS: Jerry Bengston is in on goal but pushes his shot wide

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Neither team with any real rhythm yet. Couple of good runs but nothing major about 13 mins into this game #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Jerry Bengtson (New England Revolution) left footed shot from the centre of the box misses to the right. Assisted by Lee Nguyen with a through ball.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Not sure how the flag wasn't up. Even more not sure how that wasn't put in the net! Bengtson with the best chance of the game so far #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: "Bunbury's touch kind of let him down." So business as usual? #NERevs #DamnitTeal

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Chris Tierney (New England Revolution).
Chance Myers (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 14' Bengtson finds himself all alone in front of Kronberg, but the Honduran international pushes his attempt wide of the net #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Justin Churchill
timelineItems.text: Beautiful setup by Bunbury on that play, drew around four #SKC players towards him. #MLS #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Ideal chance for Bengtson, who was offside but the flag stayed down, but his soft shot is wide. #NERevs #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Woof. That's the #NERevs season in a nutshell, basically. Gifted a chance when CLEARLY offside, pulled it wide. #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Oriol Rosell (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by A.J. Soares.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: So if recent form holds, that's the designated dangerous early chance for the opponent.

timelineItems.name: Christopher Brown
timelineItems.text: Fagundez still isn't on the same page as everyone else. Disappointing. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 17' Zusi's corner kick is karate-kicked away by Lee Nguyen. #NERevs catch #SportingKC on the break but are unable to capitalize 0-0 #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: Every time I see that Revs academy logo, I wonder why the #NERevs don't just go with that. Not creative, but still better.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).
Jerry Bengtson (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Ben Saufley
timelineItems.text: Diego getting bossed. Jerry with a sitter. But hey Daigo’s looking decent. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Andy Dorman (New England Revolution).
Toni (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Teal Bunbury fires a shot that is blocked by Sinovic

timelineItems.comment: Match ends, New England Revolution 2, Sporting Kansas City 0.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: There's the final whistle! It's a 2-0 win for the #NERevs over the defending champs. Late, late goals from @TealBunB and @LeeNguyen24.

timelineItems.name: Kristopher McDonald
timelineItems.text: Fagundez should have been able to take that. The game was in hand. He did all the work. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Taylor Twellman
timelineItems.text: Huge win for @NERevolution with 2 late goals in otherwise boring game but doesn't matter. Bunbury needed that more than you know. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: GOAL! @LeeNguyen24 powers home the PK after a @SportingKC handball. 2-0 #NERevs. http://t.co/IhRTdJUUlf #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: FT: Late, late goals fuel @NERevolution 2-0 win over @SportingKC. Highlights: http://t.co/6c9U95mBcW #NEvSKC http://t.co/2rukIkPebn

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: FT: Late, late goals fuel @NERevolution 2-0 win over @SportingKC. Highlights: http://t.co/6c9U95mBcW #NEvSKC http://t.co/2rukIkPebn

timelineItems.desc: Reprising their Eastern Conference Semifinal Series matchup from a year ago, the New England Revolution and Sporting Kansas City meet for the first time this season when the clubs face off Saturday evening at Gillette Stadium.
timelineItems.title: HIGHLIGHTS: New England Revolution vs Sporting Kansas City | April 26, 2014

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is blocked.
Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Matt Besler.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 21' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 @TealBunB latches onto @ChrisTierney8's cross and blasts a shot on target, but it's blocked by Besler. Close.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Between Besler and Collin, Kronberg has 3 posts on his goal.

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: @JamesStarritt it's hard to picture Teal hitting one very well with his left, even inside my imagination.

timelineItems.name: Luke Lohr
timelineItems.text: Oh boy, @NERevolution and @SportingKC showdown is on my docket tonight. Follow the match on Golazo here @MLS fans: http://t.co/Vn30auZvD5

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Hell of a pass from Perez, but Christian's defense here is a laugh: http://t.co/qOuMGAZuIi Slow recognition from Kitchen, too. Bad by DC.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box misses to the right. Assisted by Matt Besler.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Oh Jerry. How'd you miss that one? http://t.co/ST4S3T2hFx #NEvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is high and wide to the right.
timelineItems.title: MISS: Sal Zizzo launches his attempt over the crossbar

timelineItems.name: Ian Dunning
timelineItems.text: Skippers bicep band #nerevs #midnightriders #legend #bostonstrong http://t.co/xnhlGNDYNn

timelineItems.name: Ian Dunning
timelineItems.text: Skippers bicep band #nerevs #midnightriders #legend #bostonstrong http://t.co/xnhlGNDYNn

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: I don't think you can call the surface at Gillette a "pitch." Maybe a "welcome mat."

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: Stream the call of tonight's #NERevs match on @985TheSportsHub: http://t.co/Uk5Ay7uSbz

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: The #NERevs welcome back Benny before taking the pitch. @ Gillette Stadium http://t.co/yBIGP07VSo

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: @ChrisGeorgeKC True that. "Feilhaber plays it through the windmill to Dwyer, who cuts around the lighthouse ..."

timelineItems.name: Ben Saufley
timelineItems.text: Behind the SKC bench. Benny already looks pissy as hell. #NERevs http://t.co/yNhjbi4oIJ

timelineItems.name: Ben Saufley
timelineItems.text: Behind the SKC bench. Benny already looks pissy as hell. #NERevs http://t.co/yNhjbi4oIJ

timelineItems.name: SportingKC WUFC
timelineItems.text: Hey there. :-) #VermesArmy leeeggooooooo #SKC!!! http://t.co/u4i70sZaVC

timelineItems.name: SportingKC WUFC
timelineItems.text: Hey there. :-) #VermesArmy leeeggooooooo #SKC!!! http://t.co/u4i70sZaVC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 25' #NERevs SKC 0 Sporting KC again threatens from a long throw - they'll do that - and Dwyer flicks a header wide of the right post.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is high and wide to the right. Assisted by Benny Feilhaber.

timelineItems.name: SportingKC WUFC
timelineItems.text: Anyone know the temp there? You can see Dom's breath so it must be cold. Unless he is a fire breathing dragon. That'd be fun!!

timelineItems.comment: Lineups are announced and players are warming up.

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Teal is playing defense. I'm liking him on the wing #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Jerry Bengtson (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Best chance of the game for #SportingKC - really well-worked by everybody. Zizzo has to put that on frame 10/10 times. #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 26' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Strong chance for Sal Zizzo as he finds space in the right side of the box, but he blasts well over the crossbar.

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Eric Kronberg.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sporting with the pitching wedge shots when they need a putter.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Andy Dorman (New England Revolution) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: #SKC fans apparently have away game tickets bought for them. Should say something NE that there are 0 of them in Gillette. Ouch. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Chris Tierney.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 29' Dangerous moments for #NERevs but the #SportingKC backline holds strong. We're scoreless heading into the half-hour mark #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Jody Strauch
timelineItems.text: Please tell me it is the pitch that is making the boys move around like newborn foals. #SKC

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: #sportingkc fans. Just to prove @MindOfAbram wrong #nerevs http://t.co/yIw1uTcesJ

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: #sportingkc fans. Just to prove @MindOfAbram wrong #nerevs http://t.co/yIw1uTcesJ

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is saved in the top center of the goal.
timelineItems.title: SAVE: Eric Kronberg denies a blazing Bunbury Shot

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is saved in the top centre of the goal.
Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Eric Kronberg.

timelineItems.name: Jim Grundy
timelineItems.text: Typical Bunbury. Handball in the box and shanks the shot anyway. #SKC #NERevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 32' HUGE save by Kronberg as he tips away a Bunbury rocket from close range #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: I keep waiting for something on the field to make PV go off during one of those in-game interviews.

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Bunbury gets away with ball bouncing off his hand and rips a shot from in the area but Kronberg gets a paw to it. #NERevs #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 32' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 @TealBunB looks hungry against his former team. Gets into another dangerous spot and he's denied by Kronberg.

timelineItems.comment: Andrew Farrell (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Jonah Freedman
timelineItems.text: If you really like defensive battles, this #NEvSKC game ain't bad. If you like goals, well, shame on you, hipster.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Chris Tierney (New England Revolution).
Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick on the right wing.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Both teams having problems with the officiating tonight. Couple of tough calls both ways #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Chance Myers.

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Bunbury is really liking the amount of space that is afforded to him on the flank #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: #NERevs have made the fewest accurate crosses per game in #MLS this season, with 2.71 via @WhoScored

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Lee Nguyen is the Maggie Smith of football: Always a solid, professional performer, no matter how iffy the rest of the cast.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Dorman takes a hard hit and stays down. Clear limp as he gets up #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the centre of the box is close, but misses to the left. Assisted by Matt Besler.

timelineItems.desc: Toni Dovale (Sporting Kansas City) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Toni Dovale is shown the yellow for a bad foul on Soares

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Toni (Sporting Kansas City).
A.J. Soares (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Soares takes a hard hit there. Shaken up a bit but calls off the training staff #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Toni (Sporting Kansas City) because of an injury.
Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Rough end to Dovale's first start. Martinez coming in.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Oriol Rosell (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: An attempted clearance finds its way to Oriol Rossell whose shot is blocked

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: Right now, Teal is striking me as a ball hog. He wants to score too badly against KC tonight. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Already the thinnest area of the field so far, another one goes down in the #SportingKC midfield. Toni off after 44 minutes. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Andy Dorman.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 44' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Dovale's night comes to an end as he's replaced by Alex Martinez.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box is blocked. Assisted by Graham Zusi with a cross.
Attempt blocked. Oriol Rosell (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Teal Bunbury.

timelineItems.name: Daniel
timelineItems.text: So far it looks like, as was eloquently said by the guys on @KicktheBallKC , "a lot of guys running all over the place" #skc

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box is close, but misses to the left. Assisted by Graham Zusi with a cross following a corner.

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: #SportingKC SUB: @AlexMartinez_15 comes on for an injured @ToniDovale9 in the 44th minute #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: @Bfklin also, may I introduce you to a former #SKC hashtag that we received in the trade: #DamnitTeal

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution).
Oriol Rosell (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: End of 1st half. #NERevs 0 #SportingKC 0. The Bangtson missed opportunity looming large as both teams struggled in that half

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: Lots of action at both ends of the pitch, but #NEvSKC will enter the break scoreless. Thoughts on the first half? http://t.co/NCdKaHizoy

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: First half over. No score, but Sporting put in some wearing-down work on Revs' defense.

timelineItems.name: Christopher Brown
timelineItems.text: Poor finishing but I'm ok with that half. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City).
Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
First Half ends, New England Revolution 0, Sporting Kansas City 0.

timelineItems.name: Julian Cardillo
timelineItems.text: Halftime. #NERevs have really stuck it to #SportingKC and have worked hard to get the ball. But the finishing needs to improve.

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Certainly can't say that zeros on the scoreboard are from lack of trying. #NERevs pushing hard

timelineItems.name: Inside MLS
timelineItems.text: Revolution coach Jay Heaps to CSN on Jerry Bengtson's defensive application: "He's not working hard enough for me." #mls #NERevs

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: HT #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Relatively quiet ending to the first half and we head into the break scoreless. Will goals come after the interval?

timelineItems.name: JT Chang
timelineItems.text: Heaps calls our Bengston's lack of effort in first half. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Jake Catanese
timelineItems.text: Jay Heaps says Jerry is "not working hard enough for me" in his halftime interview...interesting... #NERevs #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: Truth be told: Great game. Too bad Jerry couldn't have scored and Teal is bad at finishing. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: Wow. Heaps called out Jerry. Did Jerry make out with his mom or something? I don't ever remember Jay calling out a player by name. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Cass
timelineItems.text: Very entertaining half in #NEvSKC. Some pleasantly suprising threading of the ball from Revs & KC looking more shapeless than I anticipated.

timelineItems.name: Jonathon Feyerherm
timelineItems.text: At halftime, @mbesler has won 6 of 7 duels (2 of 2 aerial duels), created 2 chances, and completed 86.2% (25 of 29) passes #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sporting will be attacking AR Matt Nelson's end in the second half. That'll be interesting every time the flag goes up.

timelineItems.name: Christopher Brown
timelineItems.text: The lack of scoring is obviously getting on Jay's nerves. Not good to see... #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Cass
timelineItems.text: Unfortunate loss for #SKC with Dovale's early injury, but shifting Zusi central could fill the void. He tends to be a focal point. #SanZusi

timelineItems.name: Adam McGee
timelineItems.text: Using skc's tactics back at them is holding them off. High pressure, force them to make a mistake, and capitalize. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: #NEvSKC halftime stats (SKC-NE): Attempts: 10-5 Shots on goal: 0-1 Corner kicks: 4-5 Fouls: 6-7 Possession %: 54-46

timelineItems.name: Christopher Brown
timelineItems.text: I'd also really like to know why Jay is freezing out Imbongo. I mean, I want to see Mullins as well, but still... #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Jake Catanese
timelineItems.text: #SKC took 10 shots in the first half? Really? I know none of them were any good but that's still like 5 more than I remember... #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Second Half begins New England Revolution 0, Sporting Kansas City 0.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 46' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Second half is underway ...

timelineItems.desc: Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Lee Nguyen draws a yellow for a foul on Sinovic

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: The second half is underway! Watch the final 45 minutes of #NEvSKC on @38TheSpot and #SKCTV! http://t.co/NCdKaHizoy

timelineItems.name: Prairie Rose Clayton
timelineItems.text: WE HAVE A PANTSING. I REPEAT, WE HAVE A PANTSING. #nerevs

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City).
A.J. Soares (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Lee Nguyen booked for a Yellow in the 46th minute #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: If NE is going to keep pressing, fitness is going to come into play more and more as the match wears on.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution).
Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Hand ball by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Alexi Lalas
timelineItems.text: Octopus. RT @CollinsDrew I have no idea what 90% of your tweets are about. I'm going to unfollow unless you can bump that up to 75%. FYI

timelineItems.name: Jared Bright
timelineItems.text: Stomach issues? Sounds like dovale had too many chicken wings in the locker room. #SKC #SKCNation

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: From @JakeYadrich: Dovale with stomach issues, couldn't continue. Don't blame him; that surface makes any football lover sick.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 4' Besler fires a long throw into the #NERevs penalty box. Dwyer finds a pocket of space but sends his header wide of the target. 0-0

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jerry Bengtson (New England Revolution).
Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Deep in the Fort
timelineItems.text: People calling to take Jerry out after a half as if Bunbury hasn't been ineffective for 8 games. #NERevs

timelineItems.desc: Dan Haiek and Armchair Analyst Matt Doyle preview the Saturday night Eastern Conference battle between the New England Revolution and Sporting KC. Does the New England attack have any chance against Sporting's stingy defense? Will Dom Dwyer stay hot? Find out Saturday at 730pm ET on MLS Live.
timelineItems.title: New England Revolution vs. Sporting KC April 26, 2014 Preview | Scouting Report

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Just what #SportingKC need..... another injury! Zizzo gonna have to come off after 54 minutes. Jacob Peterson to replace him. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Groin strain for Zizzo? That's not good. Guy has been a handful for fullbacks all year, and a groin strain isn't usually a one-match thing.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: SKC having to use 2 subs on injuries. Not what they were looking for after coming in banged up I imagine #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: Another injury, another sub for #SportingKC. @jacob__peterson enters the match for @SalZizzo in the 55th minute #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Charlie Davise in Jerry Bengtson out in the 57th minute. If only Jerry connected on that opportunity in the 1st half… #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Charlie Davies replacing Jerry Bengtson in the 57th minute. Heaps was clear at halftime he wasn't happy with Bengtson's effort. #NERevs

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Alex Martinez (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the right side of the box is saved in the bottom right corner.
timelineItems.title: SAVE: Bobby Shuttleworth pushes a Martinez shot wide

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Charlie Davies. Talk about a guy who slid studs-up into his own career.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 57' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 And now a first substitution for the Revs as @CharlieDavies9 is into the game for Jerry Bengtson.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Alex Martinez (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is close, but misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Alex Martinez fires a shot into the side netting

timelineItems.name: André Silva
timelineItems.text: If I've said it once, I've said it 1000 times, not a fan of Jacob Peterson being so high in the lineup. #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Alex Martinez (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the right side of the box is saved in the bottom right corner. Assisted by Oriol Rosell.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Bobby Shuttleworth.
Attempt missed. Alex Martinez (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is close, but misses to the right following a corner.
Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Aurélien Collin.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Good early run by Fagundez & Nguyen. Cant finish the chance but leads to a corner kick #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the left side of the box is blocked. Assisted by Diego Fagundez.

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: SHOOT EARLY!!! Geez, someone! ANYONE! #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: 14,806 on hand tonight @GilletteStadium. Good number for the conditions #NERevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 59' Martinez AGAIN with a good look as Zusi's corner kick is headed to the top of the box, but the Uruguayan midfielder strikes wide #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 59' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Big save by @b_shuttle, who gets low to his left to push Alex Martinez's shot around the post. Out for a corner.

timelineItems.name: madisonroad
timelineItems.text: Wow, that was bad, AJ Soares. No excuse for that. #NERevs roster needs depth.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Andy Dorman (New England Revolution).
Alex Martinez (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick on the left wing.
Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).
Bobby Shuttleworth (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Offside, New England Revolution. Lee Nguyen tries a through ball, but Charlie Davies is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Dustin Havens
timelineItems.text: Martinez, Toni's replacement, also looking useful. Excited about the young CM options emerging. #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Chris Tierney.

timelineItems.name: Jon Parker
timelineItems.text: Bobby is one distasteful moustache away from a seriously bad look. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).
Bobby Shuttleworth (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Andrew Farrell (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Kevin Smith
timelineItems.text: Great to see @CharlieDavies9 getting into action today. What an inspiration. #mls #SKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Oriol Rosell (Sporting Kansas City).
Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the right wing.

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Fagundez has been all but a ghost here in the second half for the #NERevs.

timelineItems.name: Bfklin
timelineItems.text: @Bfklin Think Bengtson is poacher that needs game time. Personally would have liked to see him w Davies, Davies on right #nerevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 6' #NERevs on the break after Fagundez intercepts a Rosell pass. Collin slides in to deflect Nguyen's cross out for a corner kick.

timelineItems.name: Julian Cardillo
timelineItems.text: #NERevs showing early on that they're going to go right at #SportingKC. Not a bad start by the hosts.

timelineItems.desc: Andy Dorman (New England Revolution) is shown the yellow card.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Andy Dorman is booked for a persistent infringement

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: @ChrisGeorgeKC Might need Jake in the Naga spot. He's always going to give effort, even if the finishing isn't there.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Darrius Barnes (New England Revolution).
Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: This is weird. Serious discussion in-game. I need some snark soon or I'm gonna pass out.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 71' #NERevs Andy Dorman issued a yellow card for persistent infringement. 0-0 #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: SportingKC WUFC
timelineItems.text: Okay #SKCNation I'm out for now and going next door to live tweet the @citizencope concert @VooDooKC! Keep the Revs shut out!! #KRONBLOCK em

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Andrew Farrell.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 71' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Yellow card to Andy Dorman, followed by a substitution as Scott Caldwell replaces Daigo Kobayashi.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Second sub for #NERevs as Scott Caldwell comes on for Daigo Kobayashi in the 72nd minute

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked. Assisted by Chance Myers.

timelineItems.name: Scott Harrington
timelineItems.text: Did you guys hear Charlie Davies got subbed in? True story. Still haven´t seen him, but he's out there. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Jon Parker
timelineItems.text: Matt Saracen has never look so good in midfield for the Revs. Sorry, I mean Scott Caldwell. #NERevs

timelineItems.desc: Aurelien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) is shown the red card.
timelineItems.title: RED CARD: Aurelien Collin is shown a straight red card for a studs up challenge

timelineItems.name: Ben Saufley
timelineItems.text: I thought Charlie’s thing was speed. Why’s he give up on that ball so quick? #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Chris George
timelineItems.text: Bout time. "@SKCgameday: 71' #NERevs Andy Dorman issued a yellow card for persistent infringement. 0-0 #NEvSKC"

timelineItems.comment: Diego Fagundez (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).
Delay in match Diego Fagundez (New England Revolution) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: The first REAL red card of Aurelien Collin's #MLS career. This is his fourth year in the league. #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Jared Coffman
timelineItems.text: Great energetic play from @Ddwyer14 so far tonight, he's all over the field. How many corners has he earned for us tonight? #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is close, but misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: MISS: Benny Feilhaber flubs a wide open look

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Straight red to Aurelian Collin on a challenge on Diego Fagundez. 100% a foul, not sure it deserved red though. #NERevs #SportingKC #MLS

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Very, very orange card, that one. One-footed, studs slightly up, did lunge a bit. #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Chris Tierney (New England Revolution) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Lee Nguyen.

timelineItems.name: Adrian
timelineItems.text: Collin red carded. That should happen more often #mls #nerevs #skc red card for his rep

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: #NERevs have a big opportunity here. Lets see if they can take advantage of this

timelineItems.name: Ed Rowe
timelineItems.text: Collin is a talent. And his reputation gets him a straight red when he doesn't get the ball. #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is close, but misses to the right following a fast break.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Well, now there's something new to talk about in the postmatch newser. Also, last sub for Sporting. Also, NE just broke another present.

timelineItems.name: Jon Parker
timelineItems.text: That usually goes against the Revs though. Collin is such an important player too. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: RED CARD! Aurélien Collin sent off for a challenge on Diego Fagundez. @SportingKC down to 10 men. #NEvSKC http://t.co/6hOfN8gfWV

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Darrius Barnes (New England Revolution).
Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 6' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 Turnover in midfield sends the Revs on a quick counter. Fagundez feeds Nguyen, whose effort is blocked out for a corner.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: I wonder if Kronberg is angling for an "Eric the Red" tag with his primary GK kit choice since becoming No. 1.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jerry Bengtson (New England Revolution).
Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Sean Fahey
timelineItems.text: When a team gets a red card against us can we give them the extra player. We seem to play worse a man up. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Taylor Twellman
timelineItems.text: That entire sequence was a debacle: Collin tackle turned red, Nguyen/Tierney free kick and then Feilhaber shank. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Guys, Vermes wasn't even pissed or livid on the sidelines. That probably says something, doesn't it? #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 79' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 @neumannrevs4 checks into the game, replacing Andy Dorman.

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: First appearance at @GilletteStadium for rookie Steve Neumann, the fourth overall pick in the 2014 #MLS SuperDraft. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 81' Kronberg does all he can to punch away the ball as Tierney whips in a cross from the left flank #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Dorman out. SKC's ankles can breathe easier.

timelineItems.comment: Diego Fagundez (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the right wing.
Foul by Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Scott Harrington
timelineItems.text: We have em right where we want them #NERevs Now take it to the corner flag for 10 minutes and try to steal a point.

timelineItems.name: NESoccerToday.com
timelineItems.text: @JamesDowning12 @chris_camille Yeah, simply amazing and then it leads to a 4-on-3 break for Kansas City while playing down a man!

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Here it is, you tell me. #SportingKC #NEvSKC http://t.co/VF7KYRhkdb

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Here it is, you tell me. #SportingKC #NEvSKC http://t.co/VF7KYRhkdb

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: Hey, Fagundez? Didn't we have a kid named that who scored goals last year? What happened to him? #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Abram the (semi)PRO
timelineItems.text: About 3 minutes away from both managers going, "Oh, well. One point is enough." #NERevs #SKC

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) right footed shot from long range on the right is close, but misses to the right. Assisted by
timelineItems.title: MISS: Lee Nguyen fires just wide from distance

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Scott Caldwell (New England Revolution).
Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Attempt missed. Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) right footed shot from long range on the right is close, but misses to the right. Assisted by Andrew Farrell.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: This means EPB in the 18 for Sporting's next match. Just realized that.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 86' Nguyen tries to beat Kronberg from distance but he pulls his shot into the side of the net #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Douglass Perry
timelineItems.text: @SoccerByIves Don't see that called red in #MLS often, but it was studs to ankle so not an outrageous call IMO #NEvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Dom Dwyer clips Soares from behind and draws a yellow

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: 86' #NERevs 0 SKC 0 @LeeNguyen24 has a crack from a tight angle and his effort is just wide of the right post. Into the dying stages now.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).
A.J. Soares (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Mario Moretto
timelineItems.text: Coach Heaps at the halftime: "Jerry's just not working hard enough for me." Kind of says it all, doesn't it? #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Dakota Kildoo
timelineItems.text: Does #NERevs know what set pieces are? They should win but for some reason don't know how to put their extra man on frame to score #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: There looks to be no intent to go in and totally wreck Fagundez from Collin, he was just late on the tackle. #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jacob Peterson (Sporting Kansas City).
Scott Caldwell (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Dwyer booked for a yellow. Into the final few minutes here with the Revs up a man. No real action though #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Justin D. Powers
timelineItems.text: Slyde the Fox is part of #NERevs marketing problem. Who is responsible for bobble head night?

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box misses to the left. Assisted by Sal Zizzo with a cross.

timelineItems.name: Justin Churchill
timelineItems.text: Both #SKC CB's, are moving the ball out of the back very well. #NERevs #MLS

timelineItems.comment: Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: Adam Gardner
timelineItems.text: Not that I'm bias or anything, but I think every call that goes against #SKC is the worst call in the history of soccer

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: Three minutes of stoppage time ... #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Total MLS
timelineItems.text: Collin's only other #MLS red card came in his first start, almost 3 years ago to the day. 4/23/11 against....New England. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: BTW, what's with these #SportingKC road games? Nothing happens for 45 minutes, then the second half is totally berserk. #SportingKC #NEvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New England Revolution 1, Sporting Kansas City 0. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from very close range to the center of the goal.  Assisted by Darrius Barnes, Diego Fagundez.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Teal Bunbury pushes a Fagundez cross into the back of the net

timelineItems.name: Jeremy Ward
timelineItems.text: BUNBURY!!! #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Ben Saufley
timelineItems.text: TEAL BUNBURY IS GOOD AT SOCCER #NEREVS

timelineItems.name: Inside MLS
timelineItems.text: Teal Bunbury at the death here in Foxborough for #NERevs.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: GOAL! Bunbury buries his 1st of the year in stoppage against his old team! The Revs that a 1-0 lead in the final moments! #NERevs

timelineItems.name: NESoccerToday.com
timelineItems.text: GOAL! Bunbury gives the #NERevs a stoppage time lead! #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Darrius Barnes (New England Revolution) header from the right side of the box is blocked. Assisted by Teal Bunbury.

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Former Sporting KC striker Teal Bunbury scores at the death and the #NERevs go up 1-0 in extra time. Wow. #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: BUNBURY!!! It's his first for the #NERevs and it's in stoppage time against his former club!

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: #NERevs grab the lead in the first minute of stoppage time as Bunbury gets the last touch on a deflected cross in the box #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: madisonroad
timelineItems.text: Bunbury scores a freak goal and #NERevs unbelievably beat #SKC 1-0.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Well, then. Bunbury. And I know the two words SKC fans are typing frantically right now.

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Scott Caldwell.

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: That's a huge, huge goal for @TealBunB, who looked like he got the final touch with his thigh. He won't care how it went in, though. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: GOAL! @TealBunB bags a stoppage-time stunner against his old club. @NERevolution lead 1-0 over @SportingKC. http://t.co/9JIq40f3C9 #NEvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Diego Fagundez (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is saved in the centre of the goal. Assisted by Charlie Davies.
Attempt blocked. Diego Fagundez (New England Revolution) header from the centre of the box is blocked.
Penalty conceded by Oriol Rosell (Sporting Kansas City) with a hand ball in the penalty area.

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New England Revolution 2, Sporting Kansas City 0. Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) converts the penalty with a right footed shot to the left corner.
timelineItems.title: GOAL:  Lee Nguyen slots home the penalty kick

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: A lot of credit should go to Darrius Barnes, who went diving in and and Kronberg was taken out of the play. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: And a penalty now. The red + the missed chance right after really bit SKC.

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Not a red? That's the biggest bit of luck for #SportingKC today, with next week in mind. #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: And @LeeNguyen24 buries the penalty to make it 2-0! #BetterLateThanNever #NERevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Kronberg stops Fagundez on a breakaway but Rosell is whistled for a handball and Nguyen puts home the ensuing PK to make it 2-0 #NEvSKC

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Hey guys, this: https://t.co/9jGrcKGtxn

timelineItems.comment: Second Half ends, New England Revolution 2, Sporting Kansas City 0.
